etymology.description: Ancient depiction of a head -> used historically for 首(首) (shǒu, "head")
etymology.interpretation: 𩠐 is an ancient character that depicted a head and was used in the past as an early form of the character 首(首) (shǒu, "head"). It emphasizes the importance of the head in many cultural contexts.

examples.chinese: 古籍中常见𩠐字(古籍中常見𩠐字)，它寓意着天地间的奥秘(它寓意著天地間的奧秘)。
examples.pinyin: gǔjí zhōng chángjiàn qiǎn zì, tā yùyì zhe tiāndì jiān de àomì.
examples.english: In ancient texts, the character 𩠐 is often seen, and it conveys the profound mysteries of the universe.

examples.chinese: 画师专注于描绘𩠐神韵(畫師專注於描繪𩠐神韻)，意在传承文化(意在傳承文化)。
examples.pinyin: huàshī zhuānzhù yú miáohuì qiǎn shényùn, yì zài chuánchéng wénhuà.
examples.english: The calligrapher focuses on depicting the unique charm of 𩠐, aiming to pass on cultural heritage.
